MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Lock() cil managed

remarks.para: Acquires the read lock.
Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread and returns immediately.
If the write lock is held by another thread then the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until the read lock has been acquired.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LockInterruptibly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Acquires the read lock unless the current thread is .

remarks.para: Acquires the read lock unless the current thread is .
Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread and returns immediately.

If the write lock is held by another thread then the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until one of two things happens:
The read lock is acquired by the current thread; or
Some other thread the current thread.

If the current thread:
has its interrupted status set on entry to this method; or
is while acquiring the read lock,
then is thrown and the current thread's interrupted status is cleared.
In this implementation, as this method is an explicit interruption point, preference is given to responding to the interrupt over normal or reentrant acquisition of the lock.

Docs.exception: if the current thread is interrupted

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryLock() cil managed

Docs.summary: Acquires the read lock only if the write lock is not held by another thread at the time of invocation.

remarks.para: Acquires the read lock only if the write lock is not held by another thread at the time of invocation.

Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread and returns immediately with the value true. Even when this lock has been set to use a fair ordering policy, a call to tryLock()will immediately acquire the read lock if it is available, whether or not other threads are currently waiting for the read lock. This "barging" behavior can be useful in certain circumstances, even though it breaks fairness. If you want to honor the fairness setting for this lock, then use which is almost equivalent (it also detects interruption).
If the write lock is held by another thread then this method will return immediately with the value false.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool TryLock (long timeout, Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryLock(int64 timeout, class Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit) cil managed

Docs.param: the time to wait for the read lock
the time unit of the timeout argument
Docs.summary: Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread within the given waiting time and the current thread has not been .

remarks.para: Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread within the given waiting time and the current thread has not been .

Acquires the read lock if the write lock is not held by another thread and returns immediately with the value true. If this lock has been set to use a fair ordering policy then an available lock will not be acquired if any other threads are waiting for the lock. This is in contrast to the method. If you want a timed tryLock that does permit barging on a fair lock then combine the timed and un-timed forms together:
if (lock.tryLock() || lock.tryLock(timeout, unit)) { ... }

If the write lock is held by another thread then the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until one of three things happens:
The read lock is acquired by the current thread; or
Some other thread the current thread; or
The specified waiting time elapses.
If the read lock is acquired then the value true is returned.

If the current thread:
has its interrupted status set on entry to this method; or
is while acquiring the read lock,
then is thrown and the current thread's interrupted status is cleared.
If the specified waiting time elapses then the value false is returned. If the time is less than or equal to zero, the method will not wait at all.

In this implementation, as this method is an explicit interruption point, preference is given to responding to the interrupt over normal or reentrant acquisition of the lock, and over reporting the elapse of the waiting time.

Docs.exception: if the current thread is interrupted
if the time unit is null

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Unlock() cil managed

remarks.para: Attempts to release this lock.
If the number of readers is now zero then the lock is made available for write lock attempts.
